intro: Epitrachys longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved epitrachys, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
